summary: This is a case overview memo from Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss dated November 5, 2020, prepared for a Deputy Attorney General (DAG) meeting. It summarizes the status of the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution, including anticipated charges, trial schedule, and plea negotiations with another Epstein co-conspirator.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Author of the case overview memo for a DAG meeting, outlining the status of the Maxwell prosecution and other related investigations.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with conspiring to entice minors to travel for sexual abuse in connection with helping Jeffrey Epstein. Her trial is set for July, and discovery and motions are ongoing.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure whose sexual abuse of minors Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with conspiring to facilitate.

connections.description: Maxwell is charged with conspiring to help Epstein abuse his victims, including participating in acts of abuse herself.
Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is overseeing the prosecution of Maxwell.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Charged
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was charged with conspiring to entice minors to travel for the purpose of sexual abuse in connection with helping Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled Motions in Maxwell Case
events.description: Motions in the U.S. v. Maxwell case are scheduled for December 2020.

events.title: Scheduled Trial for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The trial for Ghislaine Maxwell is set for July 2021.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was charged in the summer of 2020 with conspiring to entice minors to travel for sexual abuse to assist Jeffrey Epstein.
The Maxwell case focuses on three specific victims who traveled to be abused by Epstein, with Maxwell herself allegedly participating in some acts.
Plea negotiations are ongoing with counsel for another Epstein co-conspirator, who scheduled massages for Epstein but was also a victim, potentially for an obstruction of justice count.
Maxwell's defense is pressing for the identity of the specific victims, which could generate significant press if successful.
The document is a high-level prosecutorial overview prepared for the Deputy Attorney General, indicating ongoing, active management of the case at the highest levels of the DOJ.
